result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D Randall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.
  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must successfully complete the Barron County Drug Court Program. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D Randall

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Steven D Randall in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PSI discussed and corrections noted. State makes recommendation. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

Count 1: 
8 Years Prison - STAYED 48 days credit if revoked. 
4 years initial confinement. 4 years extended supervision. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

5 Years Probation - IMPOSED. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  
Must successfully complete the Barron County Drug Court Program. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Costs


Count 2: 
9 Months Jail - STAYED. (consecutive to count 1)
1 Year Probation - IMPOSED. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  
Must successfully complete the Barron County Drug Court Program. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Costs
